intro: Chamaefilix trichomanes, commonly known as the silver saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically narrow, linear, and covered in fine, silky hairs that give it a distinctive appearance. Chamaefilix trichomanes is adapted to harsh environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils and cold climates.
